unnormalised: Local tuition teacher, Mr. Sharma, nearly gave up on geometry today. Apparently, young Rohan was "solving" trigonometric equations by just guessing the values. Sharmaji said, “He’d write down 'sin(theta) = 0.5, therefore theta = 90 degrees' with a straight face! I almost choked on my chai." He added the incident occurred around 4:30 PM, during their regular session.
normalised: Local tuition teacher, Mister Sharma, nearly gave up on geometry today. Apparently, young Rohan was "solving" trigonometric equations by just guessing the values. Sharmaji said, "He'd write down 'sine of theta equals zero point five, therefore theta equals ninety degrees' with a straight face! I almost choked on my chai." He added the incident occurred around four thirty P-M, during their regular session.

unnormalised: The issue came to a head when Rohan confidently declared that the area of a circle with radius 7 cm was "approximately 150 sq. cm, give or take a few sq. cms, what's the big deal?" Mr. Sharma, who’s been teaching for 15 yrs, claims he momentarily considered a career change. The boy just wouldn’t understand that pi is roughly 3.14, not just "somewhere around 3”.
normalised: The issue came to a head when Rohan confidently declared that the area of a circle with radius seven centimeter was "approximately one hundred and fifty square centimeter, give or take a few square centimeter, what's the big deal?" Mister Sharma, who's been teaching for fifteen years, claims he momentarily considered a career change. The boy just wouldn't understand that pi is roughly three point one four, not just "somewhere around three".

unnormalised: Sharmaji ended the session early and went home to watch Kapil Sharma for stress relief. He added, "Next time, I'm bringing a protractor AND a sense of humour". He jokingly considered charging Rohan’s parents an extra Rs. 50 for "emotional distress pay”. His wife, Mrs. Sharma, suggested simplifying the maths "like they do in Bollywood movies".
